Saint-Germain |Municipality=the 6th arrondissement of Paris |Zone=1 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next|4|Saint-Michel|Saint-Germain-des-Prés}} {{Paris Metro/next|10|Mabillon|Cluny - La Sorbonne}} | X=137 | Y=88 }} '''Odéon''' is a [[metro station|station]] on [[Paris Métro Line 4|lines 4]] and [[Paris Métro Line 10|10]] of the [[Paris Métro]] in the [[6th arrondissement of Paris|6th arrondissement]] in the heart of the [[Left Bank]]. The station was opened on 9 January 1910 as part of the connecting section of the line under the [[Seine]] between [[Châtelet (Paris Métro)|Châtelet]] and [[Raspail (Paris Métro)|Raspail]]. The line 10 platforms opened on 14 April 1926 as part of the line's extension from [[Mabillon (Paris Métro)|Mabillon]]. It was the eastern terminus of the line until its extension to [[Place d'Italie (Paris Métro)|Place d'Italie]] (now on line [[Paris Métro Line 7|line 7]]) on 15 February 1930. Named after the nearby [[Odéon]] theatre, the station is located under the [[Carrefour de l'Odéon]], in the [[6th arrondissement of Paris]]. The platforms on Line 4 were opened on 9 January 1910 and the platforms on Line 10 were opened on 14 February 1926. The [[Luxembourg Palace]] is nearby. ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 4 - Odeon 01.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 4|Line 4]] platforms at Odéon File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 10 - Odeon 01.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 10|Line 10]] platforms at Odéon </gallery> [[Image:Odéon.jpg|thumb|500px|left|Panorama of the [[Paris Métro Line 4|Line 4]] Odéon station]] {{commons category|Odéon (Paris Metro)}} ==References== *Roland, Gérard (2003).
